page.title: 01Burwick to Ham Geo
page.content: The extreme southern tip of South Ronaldsay Orkney, from Burwick Bay in the west to Ham geo in the east. Mostly low lying but gradually rising to the east the land is farmed either intensively for grass to raise cattle and sheep or as rough grazing, with some unenclosed moorland and areas of exposed rock. A very strong tide race is seen off old head (12knts) Ham Geo has a beach accessible by footpath, from the cliff bound fields above, and lobster fishing, once pursued from it is now discontinued. There is a coastguard station at Brough Ness, Seldom manned, and a hut nearby storing coastal rescue equipment.There are five inhabited dwellings of which four are farms and one a retirement home. The coast from near banskhead to Broughness is of stepped rock strata. Seals can be seen in the water,
